It is a member of the Cucurbitaceae family, which includes vines and climbers, though it exhibits a more shrub-like growth habit. The plant is characterized by its striking, pale green to white flowers that resemble ghostly apparitions, hence its common name. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, Cystostemon mechowii is considered a vulnerable species.
